description:
8.56 asoftclip
Apply audio soft clipping.

Soft clipping is a type of distortion effect where the amplitude of a signal is saturated
along a smooth curve, rather than the abrupt shape of hard-clipping.

This filter accepts the following options:
name: asoftclip

options.description:
Set type of soft-clipping.

It accepts the following values:

hard
tanh
atan
cubic
exp
alg
quintic
sin
erf
options.name: type

options.description: Set threshold from where to start clipping. Default value is 0dB or 1.
options.name: threshold

options.description: Set gain applied to output. Default value is 0dB or 1.
options.name: output

options.description: Set additional parameter which controls sigmoid function.
options.name: param
